channel.title: Iron Sights Versus Crosshairs
channel.description:
Iron sights look badass if done right, and are a lot more realistic, but they limit sight and can't have things like the episode's flashlight and health meter on them. Crosshairs don't look as cool and aren't as realistic, but iron sights don't seem to fit in games like HL2. Iron sights require slow movement for accurate shooting while crosshairs don't.
I personally like both. I think iron sights work best for realism games and war games like COD and Far Cry while crosshairs work best for the sci-fi genre.
The one game I think could have used iron sights that didn't is Fallout 3, but I guess they didn't want to have to make that many more animations for every gun.

item.title: Iron Sights Versus Crosshairs
item.dc:creator: Ham_Solo
item.description:
I like ironsights, but they are not essential for me.
I also don’t think they are needed in any type of FPS. TF2 for example has a way to fast gameplay for that. They are appropriate for tactical shooters however.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Sights Versus Crosshairs
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
russilker:

…I don’t claim to be a fanboy of games like Call of Duty (I actually dislike all call of dutys except for the modern warfare ones, which are OK), but I enjoy a combination of crosshairs and iron sights. It just gives the game more variety, so why not? (I’m referring to SP only; in MP I realize it makes a diff)

wat

CoD1 and 2 are the best CoDs, no matter you saying.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Sights Versus Crosshairs
item.dc:creator: Marb
item.description:
To be honest, I’m not into ultra-realistic war-simulation type games, so the only game I can think of that I’ve even used Iron Sights in is SMOD. Didn’t really care for it. Lack of crosshairs or if it actually improved your aim considerably are the only reasons I could see to want to use iron-sites. Neither of these seemed to apply to SMOD, so it’s probably a bad example.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Sights Versus Crosshairs
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
For Iron Sights to make sense, sometimes you need to imagine that the FPS protagonist can only see out of their left eyeball.

I’m more affine to dynamic headbobbing and view-model wagging than iron sights, just because badass action dudes don’t have time to aim with precision.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Sights Versus Crosshairs
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
depends on the game, I’ll play with both.

For example, Brothers in Arms (the first 2, not the shitty third) I play without corsshairs, always using irons.

HL2? purely crosshairs.

Modern Warfare, a mix of both
.

item.title: Iron Sights Versus Crosshairs
item.dc:creator: Deutscher_Scharfschu
item.description:
i like ARMA II’s system with a Track IR for realism.

and i like the classic Valve cross hairs for casual fun. i like them both, and i think that they should both exist for certain games. Iron sights have become way too cliche IMO.

item.title: Iron Sights Versus Crosshairs
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Cross hairs aren’t necessarily unrealistic in Sci-Fi games, as by that time you’d think the tech would exist. Also, why not just have both? It works fine in a lot of games.
Personally I don’t if a game has ironsights much, they don’t really improve games at all.
